Download of Code Without Integrity Check

OWASP Top Ten 2013 Category A3 - Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)

CVE.summary: Mozilla Firefox before 3.5.12 and 3.6.x before 3.6.9, Thunderbird before 3.0.7 and 3.1.x before 3.1.3, and SeaMonkey before 2.0.7 do not properly restrict use of the type attribute of an OBJECT element to set a document s charset, which allows remote attackers to bypass cross-site scripting (XSS) protection mechanisms via UTF-7 encoding.

CWE.title: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
